Most internet browsers automatically allow websites to use cookies.

Arrangr may use cookies or other tracking mechanisms to identify when another User, website, or other service directed you to Arrangr.
Arrangr uses both persistent cookies, and session cookies.
Arrangr, like many websites, uses cookies to enhance our Service, as well as to collect additional usage data.
The following link can give you more information about disabling cookies: https://www.aboutcookies.org/Default.aspx?page=1

For example, we may use cookies to remember preferences or settings you have chosen (like your preferred time zone), and to remember what actions you have taken, so we don't have to bug you for these things multiple times.
For example, when you log on to our Site, we use authentication cookies to remember who you are and verify that you are securely logged in.
We may use cookies to market our Service to you on other sites.

data_type: token give we ability create meeting on behalf
text: We store a token which gives us the ability to create meetings on your behalf, so that we can automatically create a unique conference link for each of your Arrangr meetings.

data_type: token give we ability read from
text: We store a token which gives us the ability to read from and add to your calendar.

text: We store a token which gives us the ability to retrieve your contacts from Google.
